Patch Set 19: Code-Review+1
Patch Set 19: Code-Review+2
Change has been successfully rebased and submitted as 48fb20b9ddcf08743d34ce53582569c8a34d7da3

@Ed In our previous discussions, you mentioned that you were not in favor of having global error matchers for firmware updates. Instead, the plan of record (POR) was to rely on task state & status to determine whether the update had succeeded or failed, and then use the log service to identify any errors. This is what the new flow will bring in. Since you are making changes to this API which gets called from fwUpdateErrorMatcher, I wanted to understand if the POR has changed?

I'm not following what the question has to do with this patch?  This patch is transitioning us to the registry generated messages, as should've been done int he first place (not an OEM message).

Whether or not we have global match expressions is a different discussion, and I'm not really sure how it's related?

Yes, it's not directly related to the patch. Please disregard my previous comment. The global error matcher won't be necessary as the Activation Status interface will be updated accordingly in the new flow.
I appreciate you taking the time to review.
